data.title: New York Times Clue Of The Day

data.text:
Play Clue Of The Day

Clue of the Day

MEMORIALS & MONUMENTS

DEDICATED TO THE MEMORY OF GREAT FRENCHMEN, IT'S THE FINAL RESTING PLACE OF WOMEN TOO, INCLUDING MARIE CURIE & SIMONE VEIL

Know the correct response?

If you have a MyJeopardy! profile and would like to save your response, sign in.

If you have a MyJeopardy! profile and would like to save your response, go right ahead.

Previous Clues

17th CENTURY WRITING

IN HIS 1624 HISTORY OF VIRGINIA & NEW ENGLAND, HE INCLUDED THE FAMOUS STORY OF HIS RESCUE

Correct Response

WHO IS JOHN SMITH?

PROSE & CONGRESS

IN 2011 THIS SENATOR PUBLISHED HIS "THE SPEECH: A HISTORIC FILIBUSTER ON CORPORATE GREED & THE DECLINE OF OUR MIDDLE CLASS"

Correct Response

WHO IS BERNIE SANDERS?

THE CIVIL WAR

WHEN THE WAR STARTED, THIS FUTURE GENERAL WAS HELPING DRILL A VOLUNTEER COMPANY IN GALENA, ILLINOIS

Correct Response

WHO IS ULYSSES S. GRANT?

TRAIL

SURNAME OF SETTLER JOHN, WHO BLAZED A TRAIL TO MONTANA & LEFT HIS NAME ON A CITY THERE

Correct Response

WHO IS BOZEMAN?

BOY GENIUS

LOSING HIS BROTHER GIULIO IN 1915, HE BURIED HIS GRIEF IN MATH & PHYSICS & SOON WOWED THE ADMISSIONS PANEL

Correct Response

WHO IS ENRICO FERMI?
